Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

Target_PDS3.target_desc:
Target Description ================== TrES-3 is a star with a detected substellar companion with the same designation, TrES-3, and is a target of the Extrasolar Planet Observation and CHaracterization (EPOCh) phase of the NASA EPOXI mission. Other designations for this star are GSC 03089-00929 and 1SWASP J175207.01+373246.3. The star has the following astrometric and photometric properties:
Spectral type : G Apparent V Magnitude : 12.4 Distance : 398 (+/- 92) pc Mass : 0.924 (-0.04/+0.012) solar masses Radius : 0.813 (-0.027/+0.012) solar radii RA : 17 52 07.020 (FK5, epoch and equinox 2000) Dec : +37 32 46.18 (FK5, epoch and equinox 2000)
The substellar companion TrES-3 was discovered in 2007 by the Trans-atlantic Exoplanet Survey (TrES). The known properties of this extrasolar planet are:
Mass : 1.92 (-/+0.023) Jupiter masses Semi major axis : 0.0226 (+/-0.0013) AU Orbital period : 1.30619 (-/+1e-5) days Eccentricity : 0 Radius : 1.295 (-/+0.081) Jupiter radii Inclination : 82.15 (-/+0.21) deg
The astrometric and photometric properties were taken from the 23 June 2009 update for this planetary system in the Extrasolar Planets Encyclopedia. The encyclopedia is maintained by the Paris Observatory and is available online at http://exoplanet.eu. Please consult this web site for the most up-to-date properties.
